channel.title: sillygwailo tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from sillygwailo.

item.description:
Toronto-on-the-Lake. https://t.co/hZ2q8ZKSxo
https://t.co/crHjmyI9av
https://t.co/HG73cmyUsL
“Anyone who makes a definitive declaration about what the future will bring is not dealing in facts.” https://t.co/9p9i3UVoks
I rarely know which hashtag to use in a tweet, and even more rarely do I know why I should use them at all.
I can vouch for the quality of this gallery. If you want to see @DougCoupland’s art up close, pay it a visit. https://t.co/6sMTWgMKVp

“In Canada, the only official recognition is a federal government stipulation that the Royal Union Flag be flown alongside Canada’s flag at government installations nationwide, ‘where physical arrangements allow.’” https://t.co/iN2W5xKzxH

There’s a party happening next door, and the Ontario government’s rules for having a party in an apartment building are very clear: You must invite everybody on your floor. https://t.co/tBfv80uHp2
They must not have heard the news that the pandemic restriction against inviting members of the same floor of your apartment building when you’re holding a party was lifted some time ago.
I can’t believe I live in Toronto. https://t.co/UvzLtO3OEw
@jeffjedras Handshakes aren’t over, but I’m not reaching out anymore. This is an extreme example, but it illustrates what I’ve been doing instead: Try to match what’s offered to me.
I actually ended up reading 6 books in 2021. One book dropped off sometime during the year due to the Goodreads entry changing after its edition was updated.

I always want to feel the way playing mundane YouTube videos with the sound off and Ólafur Arnalds as the soundtrack makes me feel.
One can only listen to so much Ólafur Arnalds before they start crying.

@adamrg I wonder how many people are blocked for the same reason (maybe someone will search Twitter and find my tweet and that will unblock them). Good thing I’m a computer genius and figured it out right away.
Wikipedia blocked me from editing a page from “my” IP address because I was using Apple’s Private Relay. Turning it off made editing possible for me again. https://t.co/2xUD8qBnbs
A couple of pending decisions to not to do something anymore hinge on what I’m going to do with the increased free time.
@davewiner I thank Siri all the time.
New music from Clams Casino and Jazztronik, yessssssss. https://t.co/KfACcoovLO
@Planta No, because what if their estate starts tweeting on their behalf?
@Tinfoiling The National League isn’t the National League anymore.
*Owen Wilson Wow* https://t.co/LEI54aimbm
@gaminginthewild Yeah, exactly. https://t.co/Vuv8m5xwKA
@gaminginthewild I’ll still carry a mask around with me for a while after mandates end here (next week), but I did catch myself with the feeling that it’s easier to think about the future now.
The dikes and levees only partially holding back the surge in water proves that dikes and levees don't work. We should stop constructing them, and tear down the existing ones.

This is ultimately what I want to do, which is to bring in Pinboard links tagged a certain way to my Jekyll site. That said, I would still like, more generally, a way to pull in content via RSS to a static website. https://t.co/hYf76smKRW

I wondered about this bar given the current situation. I’m glad I got to have drinks there once, but I was uncomfortable about the decor, to say the least. https://t.co/zx5JDZLSHx
The first time I went, it was with a Russian-Canadian colleague. The second time I went, it was with an Eastern European-Canadian colleague who lived under Communism. I forget why we didn’t stay, but I do recall him talking to somebody to see if we could get past the velvet rope.
You know who else couldn’t be happier? COVID-19. https://t.co/q5Wdtodwqv
@artcaninstitute I saw Esmaa Mohamoud’s work at @TheAGH last year. The exhibition is over, but they posted a virtual tour: https://t.co/lCNXcsstso
